body_html:
@bignamehyp
OS: Ubuntu 16.04
TF version: 1.6.0
(note that it also happens to me on macOS, TF 1.6.0)

Command used:
python scripts/eval.py --logtostderr --checkpoint_dir=models/baseline --eval_dir=models/baseline/eval --pipeline_config_path=scripts/baseline.config

In the folder models/baseline, there are 3 files:
baseline-ckpt.data-00000-of-00001
baseline-ckpt.index
baseline-ckpt.meta

I also tried command
python scripts/eval.py --logtostderr --checkpoint_dir=models/baseline/baseline-ckpt --eval_dir=models/baseline/eval --pipeline_config_path=scripts/baseline.config
because in baseline.config, I have the setting fine_tune_checkpoint: "models/baseline/baseline-ckpt" and I used it to run training fine.

After adding from tensorflow.python.platform import tf_logging as logging in eval_util.py as suggested in this post, I can see that it was because of the following error

WARNING:tensorflow:shuffle is false, but the input data stream is still slightly shuffled since num_readers > 1.
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:Starting evaluation at 2018-05-02-21:07:47
INFO:tensorflow:No model found in model/baseline. Will try again in 300 seconds
INFO:tensorflow:Finished evaluation!
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "scripts/eval.py", line 162, in
tf.app.run()
File "/Users/siyuyang/anaconda/envs/tensorflow/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/platform/app.py", line 126, in run
_sys.exit(main(argv))
File "scripts/eval.py", line 158, in main
FLAGS.checkpoint_dir, FLAGS.eval_dir)
File "/Users/siyuyang/source/repos/TF_models/research/object_detection/evaluator.py", line 274, in evaluate
losses_dict=losses_dict)
File "/Users/siyuyang/source/repos/TF_models/research/object_detection/eval_util.py", line 438, in repeated_checkpoint_run
return metrics
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'metrics' referenced before assignment

Here's the relevant parts in the config file:

eval_config: {
num_examples: 16254
num_visualizations: 300
max_num_boxes_to_visualize: 200
visualize_groundtruth_boxes: true
keep_image_id_for_visualization_export: true
max_evals: 1
metrics_set: 'pascal_voc_detection_metrics'
}

eval_input_reader: {
tf_record_input_reader {
input_path: "train_images_processed/t3.record"
}
label_map_path: "scripts/label_map.pbtxt"
shuffle: false
num_readers: 1
}

Note that I set shuffle to false and num_reader to 1, but there was the warning

WARNING:tensorflow:shuffle is false, but the input data stream is still slightly shuffled since num_readers > 1.

body:
@bignamehyp 
OS: Ubuntu 16.04
TF version: 1.6.0
(note that it also happens to me on macOS, TF 1.6.0)

Command used:
`python scripts/eval.py --logtostderr --checkpoint_dir=models/baseline --eval_dir=models/baseline/eval --pipeline_config_path=scripts/baseline.config`

In the folder models/baseline, there are 3 files:
baseline-ckpt.data-00000-of-00001
baseline-ckpt.index
baseline-ckpt.meta

I also tried command
`python scripts/eval.py --logtostderr --checkpoint_dir=models/baseline/baseline-ckpt --eval_dir=models/baseline/eval --pipeline_config_path=scripts/baseline.config`
because in baseline.config, I have the setting `fine_tune_checkpoint: "models/baseline/baseline-ckpt"` and I used it to run training fine. 

After adding `from tensorflow.python.platform import tf_logging as logging` in eval_util.py as suggested in this [post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48163085/tensorflow-object-detection-api-eval-py-metrics-referenced-before-assignment), I can see that it was because of the following error

WARNING:tensorflow:`shuffle` is false, but the input data stream is still slightly shuffled since `num_readers` > 1.
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:depth of additional conv before box predictor: 0
INFO:tensorflow:Starting evaluation at 2018-05-02-21:07:47
**INFO:tensorflow:No model found in model/baseline. Will try again in 300 seconds
INFO:tensorflow:Finished evaluation!**
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "scripts/eval.py", line 162, in <module>
    tf.app.run()
  File "/Users/siyuyang/anaconda/envs/tensorflow/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/platform/app.py", line 126, in run
    _sys.exit(main(argv))
  File "scripts/eval.py", line 158, in main
    FLAGS.checkpoint_dir, FLAGS.eval_dir)
  File "/Users/siyuyang/source/repos/TF_models/research/object_detection/evaluator.py", line 274, in evaluate
    losses_dict=losses_dict)
  File "/Users/siyuyang/source/repos/TF_models/research/object_detection/eval_util.py", line 438, in repeated_checkpoint_run
    return metrics
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'metrics' referenced before assignment

Here's the relevant parts in the config file:

> eval_config: {
>   num_examples: 16254
>   num_visualizations: 300
>   max_num_boxes_to_visualize: 200
>   visualize_groundtruth_boxes: true
>   keep_image_id_for_visualization_export: true
>   max_evals: 1
>   metrics_set: 'pascal_voc_detection_metrics'
> }
> 
> eval_input_reader: {
>   tf_record_input_reader {
>     input_path: "train_images_processed/t3.record"
>    }
>   label_map_path: "scripts/label_map.pbtxt"
>   shuffle: false
>   num_readers: 1
> }

Note that I set shuffle to false and num_reader to 1, but there was the warning 

> WARNING:tensorflow:`shuffle` is false, but the input data stream is still slightly shuffled since `num_readers` > 1.
